title: Our Emily Dickinsons: American Women Poets and the Intimacies of Difference
abstract: June 01 2017 Our Emily Dickinsons: American Women Poets and the Intimacies of Difference Our Emily Dickinsons: American Women Poets and the Intimacies of Difference. By Vivian R.Pollak. (Philadelphia: University of Pennsylvania Press, 2016. Pp. 368. $55.00 cloth; $55.00 e-book.) Rebecca Morgan Frank Rebecca Morgan Frank Rebecca Morgan Frank is the Jacob Ziskind Poet in Residence at Brandeis University. Her third collection of poetry, “Sometimes We're All Living in a Foreign Country,” is forthcoming from Carnegie Mellon University Press in October 2017.
